Patch Set 11: Code-Review+2
Change has been successfully merged

Please change to:
        IP::AddressOrigin origin = addr.staticallyAssigned
                                       ? IP::AddressOrigin::Static
                                       : IP::AddressOrigin::DHCP;
Done
Patchset 9 did not include the requested change.
Intentionally not changed since we are keeping all of the lines below.
With the preceding requested change this fragment can be removed.
Ack
Patchset 9 did not include the requested change.
Intentionally not changed since we are keeping all of the lines below.
How we are handling the Link local IP address here? how to fill the origin value for the link local IP address here?
Currently, we are ignoring the link local addresses by setting the `filter.scope = RT_SCOPE_UNIVERSE`

Is this going to cause issues for people who are using Link Local addresses in the same way as ordinary IPv4 addresses? Oskar Senft, at Google, is manually assigning Link Local addresses in the same way as one would statically assign an IPv4 address.

Please add:
address.staticallyAssigned = (bool)(ifaddr.ifa_flags & IFA_F_PERMANENT);

That doesn't actually work for DHCP, systemd marks those addresses as IFA_F_PERMANENT. We currently don't have a better way to detect DHCP addresses or distinguish them from non-temporary SLAAC so I'm leaving this behavior as it was for now.
Ack

please add:
bool staticallyAssigned;
Ack
Can we declare it in util/ethernetInterface instead of ipaddress?
We can, but do I need to move the neighbor stuff too then?
I'll look into reorganizing the netlink stuff in the future.
Why the new namespace?  Is this being used outside phosphor::network namespace?
It's not meant to be used outside of this file, it's a detail of the IPAddress module
Ack
Can we make it that all parsing of netlink related function go in one place?
See the other comment

Our requirement here is to get all the IP address from the interface.
We have ready made API for the same which ultimately does the same..
What are the filters which we are planning to use in future apart from interface name/index.
Ack

William,
I took time to look through this again. I'd like to suggest a few changes.
I'd like to defer implementation of my suggestions in favor of moving this commit into the main line.

Nudge.

Can this commit get merged?
My interpretation/feedback.

I'd like to suggest the address origin be culled from the addr.flags.
Assign STATIC if IFA_F_PERMANENT is set, else DHCP.
This is per RFC 3549.

I'd also like to see addr.flags be a std::bitfield to permit "addr.flags.test(7)" or "addr.flags[7]" to be used to determine the static/dynamic assignment.
I'll change this in a follow up, I don't want to affect that behavior here so that we can revert a smaller change.
what about ipv6 SLAAC addresses?

SLAAC are not link local.
To get a SLAAC you need an Routing Adv server.
SLAAC is a form of dynamic address configuration. You don't get one without an RA.
IMO, they are "dynamic" because they aren't "static", or "link local".

I understand that SLAAC is not link local.

I am trying to figure out if there is  a way to differentiate DHCPv6 and SLAAC addresses
There isn't currently, you would have to be able to get the info from networkd (which it doesn't expose)
adjust if 'flags' is std::bitfield
Ack
Same as line 121
Ack

make a std::bitfield<32> ?
This will allow ethernet_address.cpp to identify static vs dynamic using
addr.flags.test(7)

Sure, but it kinda defeats the purpose of using the named constant. I'd much rather use the well defined c type + bitmask than have to define my own constants that should match what the system is using.

I played with it and it made the comparison way more ugly, it would be fine if bitset was more natively used for the netlink types, but it is more concise in c-style.
